item.title: Pokemon Let's Go: 18 Things To Do After You Beat The Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Gear up for post-game fun after becoming Pokemon Champion by facing tougher battles & collecting Mega Stones.
  • Don't miss out on the opportunity to own the elusive Pokemon Mew with the purchase of the Pokeball Plus controller.
  • Expand your Pokemon collection by trading over Meltan and Melmetal from Pokemon Go , unique non-Kantonian species.

When Pokemon: Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee were first announced for the Nintendo Switch, old-school fans of the series were delighted. Returning to the magical world of Kanto, the games feature the original 151 Pokemon as well as one or two special additions. Unlike the original games, however, there are still quite a few fierce battles to be fought even after the Indigo Plateau.

Much like many of the recent Pokemon games, Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee have plenty of post-game content that should keep players busy long after they've become the Pokemon Champion. There are plenty of compelling reasons to stick around for a little while longer, whether it be catching additional Pokemon or seeking out new and more challenging opponents.

Updated March 18, 2025, by Ben Painter: The latest entry in the franchise, Pokemon Scarlet & Violet, has been out for some time now, along with its DLC. So, gamers may want to get their Pokemon fix by playing a different game while they wait for the release of the next entry, Pokemon Legends: Z-A. Why not head back onto Pokemon Let's Go: Pikachu or Let's Go Eevee and try to 100% complete the game on the Nintendo Switch? There is lots to do after the Elite Four & Champion have been completed, and this update adds even more things to do in the Pokemon Let's Go: Pikachu & Eevee post-game.

1 Buy Some Outfits For Pikachu & Eevee

Gamers Can Dress Up Their Partner Pokemon

  • Location: Various, Celadon Department Store
  • Things Required: Money

Throughout the game, players are given outfits for their characters from various NPCs in the Kanto region. Each of these outfits comes with a cap for either Pikachu or Eevee, which matches the costume of the player.

There are a few other hats that can be purchased for the in-game currency from the Celadon Department store. Also available are various glasses, bows, and flowers — trying to collect them all could be something to do in the end-game. The big prize of this is the Crown, which costs a staggering $999,999 from the Celadon Department Store. It will be a massive grind to get this amount of cash. Only worth it for those looking to collect everything and anything in Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee .

2 Collect All Of The Alolan Forms

Different Versions Of The Original Kanto Pokemon

  • Location: Various
  • Things Required: The Original Version Of The Pokemon

Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee are unique in the franchise for taking things back to basics and only including the original 151 Pokemon in the game. However, there are a few exceptions, and these are the Alolan forms of certain Pokemon, which can be traded to the player by an NPC and are found in the Pokemon Centers of every major town or city in Kanto.

These Alolan forms were originally introduced in Pokemon Sun & Moon as regional variants of some Red & Blue Pokemon, which have different appearances and types. Although these Pokemon don't add to the Pokedex total, it is nice to catch them in order to fully complete the game.

Pokemon

Location

Version

Rattata

Cerulean City

Both

Geodude

Vermillion City

Both

Diglett

Lavender Town

Both

Sandshrew

Celadon City

Let's Go Pikachu

Vulpix

Celadon City

Let's Go Eevee

Raichu

Saffron City

Both

Marowak

Fuchsia City

Both

Grimer

Cinnabar Island

Let's Go Pikachu

Meowth

Cinnabar Island

Let's Go Eevee

Exeggutor

Indigo Plateau

Both

3 Collect All Mega Stones

Time To Mega Evolve Some Pokemon

  • Location: Pallet Town, Cerulean Cave, The Pokemon League
  • Things Required: Money, A Strong Pokemon Team

Mega Evolution was originally introduced in Generation 6 with Pokemon X & Y. Certain Pokemon are granted an extra evolution that can only be done in battle with the use of a held item, a Mega Stone. Other than that generation, the gimmick was largely forgotten about in the franchise. An often-overlooked fact is that Mega Evolution is present in Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee .

There are a total of 15 to collect in the game. Four of those are given as part of the story, for the evolved form of the Kanto starters. Another two, for Mewtwo, are rewarded for defeating Green. The rest can be purchased from a man dressed as Slowpoke in The Pokemon League. Make it the player's goal to collect them all!

Mega Stone

Pokemon

Location

Venusaurite

Venusaur

Pallet Town (before fighting Viridian City Gym)

Charizardite X

Charizard

Pallet Town (before fighting Viridian City Gym)

Charizard

Cerulean Cave (after defeating Green)

Mewtwoite Y

Mewtwo

Cerulean Cave (after defeating Green)

4 Buy The Pokeball Plus And Catch Mew

The Only Way To Get The Mythical Pokemon In The Base Game

  • Location: N/A
  • Things Required: Pokeball Plus Controller

Out of the original 151 Pokemon, the mythical Pokemon Mew is the hardest to acquire. Back in Pokemon Red & Blue , it was only available through in-person events. The trend of this being the case continued in the remakes, Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee .

The only way to get Mew on the Nintendo Switch title is to purchase the additional controller, the Pokeball Plus, which came with a code for Mew to be added to the Pokedex. This comes with an additional cost, an unnecessary one, as the game can be played with the regular Nintendo Switch joycons. Some fans even prefer doing so. However, to complete the Pokedex, it is required. Unless fans want to trade a Mew from Pokemon Go , or another game.

Mew Base Stats:

HP:

100

Attack:

100

Defense:

100

Sp. Atk:

100

Sp. Def:

100

Speed:

100

Total:

600

5 Trade Over Meltan & Melmetal From Pokemon Go

The Only Non-Kantonian Pokemon Available In The Games

  • Location: N/A
  • Things Required: Pokemon Go , A Pokemon To Trade

Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu & Eevee have the unique trait of only having the Pokemon from the region it’s set in to be available in the game (aside from the Alolan forms of Kanto Pokemon). However, there are two exceptions to this: The Mythical Pokemon Meltan and its evolved form, Melmetal.

These elusive Pokemon are only available in this game in a special way. When a Pokemon is traded from the mobile game Pokemon Go onto the Switch, a Mystery Box will appear in Pokemon Go . This will allow the Meltan to spawn, and then it can be traded into Let's Go . Meltan cannot be evolved in Pokemon Let's Go , so Melmetal must be evolved on Pokemon Go and then traded over, using 400 Meltan candies.

Base Stats:

Meltan

Melmetal

6 Rematch All Gym Leaders

Take On The Kanto Gym Leaders With Stronger Teams

  • Location: Their Respective Gyms
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

A common theme in the Pokemon games' post-game is to take on the Gym Leaders for a rematch. The Gym Leaders of Kanto have stronger Pokemon teams, higher levels, and additional Pokemon once the Elite Four & Champion have initially been defeated.

It would be wise to take on the Gyms for a second time for a tougher battle to really put the player's Pokemon skills to the test. Each trainer now has a team of five for the player to take on, all matching the type of their Gym. Unlike the regular playthrough of the game, these Gyms can be taken on in any order.

Gym Leader's Rematch Teams:

Brock

Pewter City

Rock

Arcanine lv.57

7 Rematch The Elite Four & Champion

Stronger Teams & New Pokemon

  • Location: The Pokemon League
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

Once the Gym Leaders have been taken care of, the Elite Four and the Champion can also again be battled. Their teams have been upgraded with higher levels, new Pokemon, and even some Alolan forms of Kanto Pokemon.

It will take some battling expertise to master the final chapter of the game for the second time. The Elite Four now have a full team of six Pokemon, with a few different variations of their typings, so it is not a straightforward affair when it comes to type match-ups. Make sure to assemble a strong team of Pokemon, as they cannot be switched out of the party once entering the Indigo League. Also, stock up with plenty of items to heal Pokemon after each battle.

Elite Four & Champion Rematch Teams:

Lorelei

Ice

Dewgong lv.61

Jynx lv.61

8 Fly!

Take To The Skies With Select Pokemon

  • Location: N/A
  • Things Required: Pokemon That Can Fly

After becoming Pokemon Champion, players will be able to select a second Pokemon to travel alongside them and their starter Pokemon. Choosing Charizard — or any other large, Flying-type Pokemon — will enable them to soar above buildings and walls, which can make traversing the game's world considerably easier.

In addition to this, players will also be able to encounter other Flying-type Pokemon while they're up in the air. Many of these are fairly common Pokemon like Spearow and Pidgey, although, on rare occasions, Charizard and Dragonite can sometimes spawn.

  • Pokemon That Can Used To Fly:

  • Charizard, Aerodactyl, Dragonite

9 Finish Catching The Legendary Birds

Articuno, Zapdos & Moltres Are Available

  • Location: Seafoam Islands (Articuno), Victory Road (Moltres), Power Plant (Zapdos)
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team, A Lot Of Ultra Balls Or The Master Ball

The three Legendary Birds can technically be caught before heading to the Pokemon League — Articuno in the Seafoam Islands, Moltres on Victory Road, and Zapdos at the Power Plant. While the first two are en-route though, Zapdos is pretty out of the way, meaning that many players skip catching it the first time around.

For those who didn't find time to visit the Power Plant or, for whatever reason, didn't catch Articuno or Moltres, doing so after becoming Champion is an absolute must. Each requires players to solve a puzzle to get to them, although they're fairly easy to catch once they've been encountered since they cannot run away.

Base Stats:

Articuno

Zapdos

Moltres

HP:

95

90

90

Attack:

85

90

100

100

90

125

85

Total:

580

580

580

10 Catch Mewtwo

The Strongest Pokemon In The Game

  • Location: Cerulean Cave
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team, A Lot Of Ultra Balls Or The Master Ball

Unlike the locations of the Legendary Birds, the Cerulean Cave cannot be accessed until after players have emerged victorious in the Pokemon League. In the cave, dwelling deep within its depths, players will find the incredibly powerful Mewtwo.

This level 70 Pokemon is nowhere near as easy to catch as the Legendary Birds, so many players opt to save their Master Ball for this occasion. His immense power makes this a pretty tough battle, as too does the five-minute timer. It's therefore a good idea to save beforehand, although thankfully, defeating the Elite Four again will cause him to respawn if players run out of time or are defeated.

Mewtwo Base Stats:

Mewtwo

Mega X

Mega Y

HP:

106

106

106

Total:

680

780

11 Challenge Green In Cerulean Cave

A New Character Who Gives A Special Reward

  • Location: Cerulean Cave
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

After players have caught Mewtwo and emerged from the Cerulean Cave, Trace will appear and tell them to head back inside and look for a girl who was searching for them. Before doing so, though, it's a very good idea to heal any injured Pokemon.

Upon re-entering the cave, players will find Green waiting for them , and she will challenge them to a battle. This is no ordinary trainer, however, with the sheer strength of her team meaning that she'll likely cause quite a few problems for unprepared players.

Green's Team:

Pokemon

Level

Type

Moves

Held Item

Clefable

66

Water

Hydro Pump/Flash Cannon/Ice Beam/Fake Out

Blastoiseite

12 Challenge Blue At Viridian Gym

The Original Rival From Pokemon Red & Blue

  • Location: Viridian City Gym
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

Once Green has been taken care of, the next post-game battle for players to seek out is Blue. He'll be waiting at the gym in Viridian City and, like Green, has access to some incredibly powerful Pokemon.

His team consists of Pokemon who are all level 66 or higher and even includes a level 68 Mega Charizard Y. This isn't the only gym that can be re-challenged either, although it is definitely the most difficult of the eight that are available.

Blue's Team:

Pokemon

Level

Type

Moves

Held Item

Tauros

66

Normal

Double-Edge/Rock Slide/Earthquake/Iron Tail

None

Alakazam

66

None

Gyarados

None

66

Rock Slide/Earthquake/Iron Tail/Crunch

None

Charizard

68

Fire/Flying

Fire Blast/Dragon Pulse/Hyper Beam/Air Slash

Charizardite Y

13 Battle The Master Trainers

Take On Some Of The Elite Battlers In The Kanto Region

  • Location: Various
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

After defeating the Elite Four, players may start to notice that many of the game's trainers now have a Pokemon symbol floating above their heads. Placing that specific Pokemon at the front of their party will allow players to fight these trainers once more.

Although they are a little more difficult the second time around, the real challenge is finding them all. There are a lot of them scattered around Kanto — 153, to be exact — so those hoping to complete all of the extra content in the game can expect to devote quite a bit of time to tracking them all down.

14 Challenge Red At The Indigo League

The Original Protagonist Of Pokemon

  • Location: The Pokemon League
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team

Once players have defeated six of the master trainers, Red will finally appear outside of the Pokemon League. He's considerably more difficult than both Blue and Green combined due to him boasting a team of Pokemon that are all level 85.

Players should aim for a team that is at least level 75 before taking him on and stocking up on max revives, max potions and full restores is something of a must. Challenging though he may be, defeating Red is definitely possible and the sign of a true Pokemon Champion.

Red's Team:

Pokemon

Level

Type

Moves

Held Item

Pikachu

85

Electric

Thunderbolt/Brick Break/Iron Tail/Reflect

None

Machamp

85

Fighting

Superpower/Fire Blast/Earthquake/Hyper Beam

None

Arcanine

85

Fire

Heatwave/Crunch/Will-O-Wisp/Roar

None

Lapras

85

Water/Ice

Ice Shard/Waterfall/Body Slam/Megahorn

None

Snorlax

85

Normal

Toxic/Protect/Rest/Body Slam

None

Venusaur

85

Grass/Poison

Sludge Bomb/Mega Drain/Leech Seed/Amnesia

Venusaurite

15 Complete The Pokedex

Get The Original 151 Pokemon In The Pokedex

  • Location: Various
  • Things Required: A Lot Of Pokeballs, Trading, or Pokemon Go

To get hold of a Diploma, players will need to complete their entire Pokedex . Although a daunting task, it's at least a little easier than it was in previous games, as most Pokemon can now be captured in the wild. Of course, finding them all can still be a bit of a chore.

There are a handful of Pokemon that are only available in one of the two versions of the game though, meaning that they'll either need to be traded or transferred in. Thankfully, however, this is now as simple as heading over to Fuschia City and importing them from Pokemon Go !

16 Shiny Hunt

These Alternate Colored Versions Of Pokemon Are Rare

  • Location: Various
  • Things Required: A Lot Of Pokeballs, Trading, or Pokemon Go

If players take their Diploma to the incredibly meta "Game Freak Headquarters" in Celadon City, they'll be able to get their hands on a Shiny Charm. As the name might suggest, this valuable item increases the chances of running into a shiny Pokemon by a huge amount.

Shiny Pokemon , of course, aren't any more powerful than their regular counterparts, although many of them do look considerably cooler. There's also the matter of bragging rights as well, with some players taking great pride in their collection of shinies.

17 Battle & Trade Online

Take The Pokemon Game Globally

  • Location: N/A
  • Things Required: A Strong Pokemon Team, Wi-Fi Capabilities

The online features of Pokemon Let's Go allow players to battle and trade with friends — or, if they're so inclined, random people. When battling, all Pokemon get set to level 50 to keep things fair, although it's still possible to use the Key Stone to help things along.

Given the amount of hard work that goes into catching all of the game's Legendary Pokemon and tracking down shiny Gen 1 variants, the online areas of the games serve as a great place to show them all off. Of course, there are also plenty of challenging opponents there just waiting to be battled, making it a great training ground for those who've already defeated Red, Blue, and Green.

18 Start The Game Again With A New Challenge

Play The Game In A Different Way

  • Location: N/A
  • Things Required: N/A

After everything has been completed in the game, sometimes the best thing to do is to just restart and complete the game again from the beginning. However, gamers may want to put a twist on this, playing Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu or Eevee in a slightly different way.

A common way for fans to do this is the Nuzlocke Challenge . Gamers can only catch the first Pokemon they see on each route, and once a Pokemon faints, it is considered dead. These are the two main rules, but others can be used to add even more of a challenge. There are countless ways that a Pokemon game can be played; healing isn't allowed, players can only use Pokemon of a certain type or even just use one Pokemon altogether. It makes for a quick and easy way to spice up a new playthrough.

item.title: WWE 2K25 MyFACTION Locker Codes (March 2025)
item.description:
Just like in previous installments and many other 2K Sports titles, players can use WWE 2K25 Locker Codes to get a bunch of great in-game goodies, including VC, free packs, and special MyFACTION Persona Cards. The latter of these can be used to unlock new wrestlers for use in other game modes and so are especially desirable among players.

Unfortunately, WWE 2K25 MyFACTION Locker Codes don't come around all that often and tend to expire rather quickly when they do. With this in mind, fans of the game will need to be on their toes to avoid missing out on the in-game goodies they provide, which is where this WWE 2K25 codes list should come in handy.

Updated March 19, 2025, by Tom Bowen: A new WWE 2K25 Locker Code has just been released. With the code DIRTYDOMMASKED , sports entertainment fans can unlock a MyFACTION Persona card for the masked version of Dominik Mysterio '23 as well as 7,500 VC. After doing so, they should take a few moments to bookmark this page so that they can check back here often, as we're constantly on the lookout for new WWE 2K25 Locker Codes and will update the list below with any that we find.

All WWE 2K25 Locker Codes

Working WWE 2K25 MyFaction Locker Codes

Locker Code

Reward

Expiry Date

DIRTYDOMMASKED

Dominik Mysterio '23 (Masked) +7,500 VC

April 18, 2025

WWE 2K25 codes are case-sensitive, so players should be sure to use all caps when typing them in.

Expired WWE 2K25 MyFaction Locker Codes

  • ELITEROCK2K25
  • WELCOMEWWE25

How to Redeem Codes for WWE 2K25

Assuming players have already completed the MyFACTION tutorial, redeeming WWE 2K25 Locker Codes is incredibly straightforward, particularly if players have experience redeeming codes in previous WWE 2K games. However, for those having trouble or anyone who is new to the experience, the following step-by-step instructions should help.

  1. Launch WWE 2K25 and enter MyFACTION mode.
  2. Click on Locker Codes, which is on the bottom row of the Live tab.
  3. Type in one of the working WWE 2K25 MyFACTION Locker Codes from the table above and then press ENTER.

How to Get More WWE 2K25 Locker Codes

WWE 2K25 MyFACTION Locker Codes are sometimes posted in the news section on the latest news section that appears when players first boot up the game. From time to time, they'll also be posted on the @WWEgames Twitter page. However, the best way to stay up to date with all of the latest Locker Codes for WWE 2K25 is to bookmark this page and check back here often, as we're always on the lookout for new codes and will add any that we find to the table above.

item.title: 8 Survival Games With The Steepest Learning Curves, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Survival games' learning curves vary, making them difficult for new players to navigate.
  • Subnautica offers a unique ocean survival experience with a terrifying nature.
  • This War of Mine presents players with tough choices for long-term survival in a war-torn setting.

After the massive success of Minecraft , the indie game world exploded with new survival games, dominating the majority of the 2010s until the Battle Royale genre emerged to take its place. However, in that time, the survival game genre matured and developed some great experiences for dedicated fans.

The only problem is that sometimes these games assume a player has experience with survival games, which means they can have steep learning curves for new players. Whether it's exploring hostile oceans or the zombie apocalypse, there are a lot of survival games out there with steep learning curves. These aren't ranked by how good the games are but by how hard they are to get to grips with as a new player, particularly if they require guidance from a veteran or reading online to figure out how to excel.

8 Subnautica

Under The Sea

Subnautica executed an idea so simple that it's hard to believe no one had done it before. Take the ever-popular open-world survival game, and make most of the world an ocean instead of land. What results is one of the most unique survival games in the entire genre, and the most terrifying too.

However, as much as Subnautica is self-evidently brilliant, it doesn't explain the different nature of its biomes well, or how to conquer the terrifying monsters of the deep, often requiring searching online instead. It's not too bad once the player has to do the research, but there's a definite learning curve to become the true master of the sea.

7 This War of Mine

War Is Hell

While games with a political message have almost always been a part of the gaming landscape, things ramped up significantly in the 2010s when indie games free of big publisher interference or money, could do or say whatever they liked, resulting in games like This War Of Mine which put the player in a war-ridden hellscape and puts them in the impossible position to survive.

This War Of Mine necessitates difficult choices with very few resources available where mistakes are easy to make. If the player wants to succeed, they'll need to try and circumnavigate a game that's doing its damndest to ensure they don't. Determining long-term survival in This War Of Mine requires time, patience, and emotional resiliency.

6 Sons of the Forest

Cannibal and Mutant Neighbors

One of the most popular sub-genres of the survival game is the horror-survival game, where not only does the player have to survive against the natural elements, but usually some form of terrifying creature simultaneously. The Forest remixed this idea with cannibals and mutants, and Sons of the Forest iterated on those ideas into one of the finest horror-survival games ever made.

However, Sons of the Forest is very resistant to tutorials or holding the player's hand, meaning they need to learn the hard way about mutant/cannibal behaviors, effective defenses, which items are worth seeking out, and which mutants might even be friendly. A lot of mistakes must be made before a new player can genuinely thrive on the hellish island.

5 The Long Dark

Hell Frozen Over

For some survival games, they want to lean as hard as they can into the harshness of the survival elements, involving many meters following sleep, hunger, thirst, warmth, sanity, and more. The Long Dark is one such game, following a lone survivor in a frozen over wilderness, struggling to survive against the elements.

It's exceptionally rare for a new player to succeed their first few times through The Long Dark. The game tutorializes little, and players are forced to figure out for themselves the best strategy for survival.

4 Green Hell

Jungle Fever

Green Hell is a surprisingly simple premise, but harkens back to one of the greatest challenges humans have: how do we survive in areas of the planet tailor-made to kill us? The jungle is one such place where every minute requires constant vigilance if the survivor doesn't want to end up caring for the local wildlife.

Green Hell takes an admirably detailed approach to simulate the jungle-survival process, where the player constantly needs to be on the lookout for traditional survival meters, as well as hostile animals, bug bites, and disease. Even starting a fire is a major problem. It's incredibly stressful, and a hard time to survive, even for veteran players.

3 RimWorld

Survivalist Mentality

Though survival games may have first come to mainstream prominence in the 2010s, games like Dwarf Fortress are the original survival games, top-down simulators of entire colonies the player needs to look after, and RimWorld is the clear successor to that addictive legacy.

In RimWorld , players are tasked with building a base on an alien planet, making a shelter, and thriving under rival faction attacks. Players don't have direct control, so they can only issue a queue of commands that the pops will execute when they can, resulting in a high-skill environment where mistakes are easy to make. The majority of player's first bases are unlikely to see past a week.

2 Project Zomboid

The Undead Rise

Of course, while survival games love to put the player into hostile environments like the ocean, the jungle, or the icy Arctic, one of the most popular survival scenarios of the 2010s was the zombie apocalypse, and Project Zomboid remains the premier simulator of that particular scenario.

In the game, players must scrap together resources, build a base, and somehow find a way to survive an increasingly dire zombie apocalypse where every bite is lethal. The game is brutally difficult, making it difficult for new players, but immensely rewarding for old hands.

1 Dwarf Fortress

The OG Survival Challenge

Most survival games want the player to have their character or civilization survive, but not so with Dwarf Fortress . This ASCII classic, now treated to a graphical overhaul, doesn't want the player to fail but to fail horribly and irreparably, giving Dwarf Fortress its reputation of brutal difficulty.

Not only does Dwarf Fortress intentionally let players make dire mistakes that can doom a newly minted Dwarven society, but it encourages it. Often, these doomed fortresses meet a farcical demise, with many veteran players having more failures than successes.

item.title: Every Major Video Game Release Coming Soon For Xbox Series X|S And Xbox One
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Xbox Games Coming Out In March 2025
  • Xbox Games Coming Out In April 2025
  • Xbox Games Coming Out In May 2025
  • Major 2025 Xbox Games With Post-May Dates Or No Release Dates
  • Major Upcoming Xbox Games With No Release Year

At this point, the Xbox Series X/S is a known commodity that has amassed a pretty respectable library of games, covering both major AAA projects and indie darlings. Microsoft opted for a dual-tier system for this generation, offering the high-end Xbox Series X alongside the more budget-friendly Xbox Series S, with the latter being digital-only. Game Pass has continued to flourish over the last few years, with any Xbox console exclusives typically debuting directly on the subscription service.

The last few years have produced plenty of fantastic games, particularly in the open-world genre. Elden Ring , Lego Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga , A Plague Tale: Requiem , and Tiny Tina's Wonderlands were all good or great 2022 releases, and they offered wildly different experiences from each other. The year's successor largely followed suit with projects like Dead Space , Street Fighter 6 , Hi-Fi Rush , Remnant 2 , Forza Motorsport , and Lies of P . Meanwhile, 2024 produced big games like S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 and Indiana Jones and the Great Circle . What upcoming 2025 Xbox games are the most exciting? Which titles are expected to drop in 2025?

Please note that the focus is on the North American release dates of Xbox Series X/S and Xbox One games . Expansions will also be listed.

Updated March 19, 2025 by Mark Sammut: The upcoming Xbox games were added to the calendar over the last two weeks: Age of Wonders 4: Giant Kings, Monaco 2, Pipistrello and the Cursed Yoyo, Hero's Hour, I Have No Mouth, and I Must Scream, Shadow of the Orient, My Little Universe, The Renovator: Origins, Ixion, Hot Rod Mayhem, I, Robot, Leila, Architect Life: A House Design Simulator.

Xbox Games Coming Out In March 2025

Suikoden, Tales Of The Shire, & More

March has a couple of notable 2025 Xbox games . Two Point Museum will likely be remembered as one of the year's best management games. JRPG fans are eating well throughout the month, starting with Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster , a compilation that offers great value for money. Atelier Yumia seems to be an interesting evolution of Gust's franchise. Split Fiction and Fragpunk should keep multiplayer fans busy, with the former being a co-op-only game by the team behind It Takes Two.

Assassin's Creed Shadows has been through a few delays, but it is finally launching on March 20, 2025. Ubisoft's Japan-based project has not enjoyed the smoothest pre-launch life, but it could come together in the end. Atomfall will be debuting directly on Game Pass too.

  • March 4 : Age of Mythology: Retold - Immortal Pillars (XBX/S)
  • March 4 : Carmen Sandiego (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 4 : PowerWash Simulator: Wallace & Gromit Special Pack (XBX/S)
  • March 4 : Two Point Museum (XBX/S)
  • March 4 : War Robots: Frontiers (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 6 : Care Bears: To The Rescue (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 6 : Eldrador Creatures Shadowfall (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 6 : Fragpunk (XBX/S)
  • March 6 : Memory Lost (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 6 : Morkull Ragast's Rage (XBX/S)
  • March 6 : Slime Heroes (XBX/S)
  • March 6 : Sorry We're Closed (XBX/S)
  • March 6 : Split Fiction (XBX/S)
  • March 6 : Suikoden 1 & 2 HD Remaster (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 7 : Aery - Dream Land (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 7 : Alter Age (XBX/S)
  • March 7 : Sugardew Island (XBX/S)
  • March 10 : Tinkertown (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 10 : Warside (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 11 : Beyond The Ice Palace 2 (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 11 : Centum (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 11 : Chornobyl Liquidators (XBX/S)
  • March 11 : Wanderstop (XBX/S)
  • March 12 : FATE: Reawakened (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 14 : WWE 2K25 (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 18 : Lost Records: Bloom and Rage Tape 2 (XBX/S)
  • March 18 : MLB The Show 25 (XBX/S)
  • March 19 : KinnikuNeko: Super Muscle Cat (XBX/S)
  • March 20 : Assassin's Creed Shadows (XBX/S)
  • March 21 : Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 21 : Bleach: Rebirth of Souls (XBX/S)
  • March 21 : Hero's Hour (XBX/S)
  • March 25 : Breakout Beyond (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 27 : Atomfall (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 27 : Blue Wednesday (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 27 : The First Berserker: Khazan (XBX/S)
  • March 27 : Gal Guardians: Servants of the Dark (XBX/S, XBO)
  • March 27 : I Have No Mouth, and I Must Scream (XBX/S)
  • March 27 : Instruments of Destruction (XBX/S)
  • March 27 : Karma: The Dark World (XBX/S)
  • March 27 : Shadow of the Orient (XBX/S)
  • March 27 : Sports: Renovations (XBX/S)
  • March 28 : Dollhouse: Behind The Broken Mirror (XBX/S)
  • March 31 : Post Trauma (XBX/S)

Xbox Games Coming Out In April 2025

Fatal Fury, South of Midnight, & More

April 2025 should be a pretty good month, if not necessarily a great one. Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves is a huge announcement, at least when it comes to the fighting genre. SNK has been producing gold for decades by this point, and the upcoming release seems set to be a culmination of all that work. For other confirmed releases, Mandragora should be a fun 2D Soulslike, a genre that has become slightly overexposed in recent years. Yasha: Legends of the Demon Blade is an isometric action RPG, and Poppy Playtime Triple Pack is a horror compilation.

So far, the biggest April 2025 Xbox game is South of Midnight , which looks set to be a fun blend of reality and folklore. As Hazel, players will explore the Deep South while subduing mythological beasts that, going by the trailer, have very cool designs.

  • April 1 : Age of Wonders 4: Giant Kings (XBX/S)
  • April 4 : My Little Universe (XBX/S)
  • April 4 : The Renovator: Origins (XBX/S)
  • April 8 : Ixion (XBX/S)
  • April 8 : South of Midnight (XBX/S)
  • April 9 : Commandos: Origins (XBX/S)

  • April 10 : Monaco 2 (XBX/S)
  • April 10 : Monster Energy Supercross 25 - The Official Video Game (XBX/S)
  • April 10 : Poppy Playtime Triple Pack (XBX/S)

  • April 10 : Steel Seed (XBX/S)
  • April 10 : The Talos Principle: Reawakened (XBX/S)
  • April 11 : Big Buck Hunter: Ultimate Trophy (XBX/S)

  • April 17 : Tempopo (XBX/S, XBO)

  • April 24 : Amerzone - The Explorer's Legacy (XBX/S)
  • April 24 : Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 (XBX/S)
  • April 24 : Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves (XBX/S)
  • April 24 : Yasha: Legends of the Demon Blade (XBX/S, XBO)
  • April 30 : MotoGP 25 (XBX/S, XBO)

Xbox Games Coming Out In May 2025

Doom, Elden Ring, Dune, & More

While April should be a solid month for Xbox gamers, its successor will be fantastic. Doom: The Dark Ages will launch immediately on Game Pass, making id Software's latest FPS onslaught available to as wide of an audience as soon as possible. Even if Doom Eternal was somewhat more divisive than the 2016 reboot, Doom: The Dark Ages is still one of the most highly anticipated sequels of the year.

The good times do not stop there either, as Dune Awakening will arrive just a couple of days later. Players will get to explore Arrakis in the form of an open-world survival game. Finally, the month ends with one of the more baffling multiplayer spin-offs in recent memory: Elden Ring Nightreign . Yes, FromSoftware is returning to the Lands Between for a standalone concept that appears to incorporate elements from the battle royale genre.

  • May 1 : Despelote (XBX/S, XBO)
  • May 6 : Captain Blood (XBX/S, XBO)
  • May 6 : Metal Eden (XBX/S)
  • May 8 : Empyreal (XBX/S)
  • May 8 : Revenge of the Savage Planet (XBX/S)
  • May 15 : Doom: The Dark Ages (XBX/S)
  • May 16 : Capcom Fighting Collection 2 (XBO)
  • May 20 : Dune Awakening (XBX/S)
  • May 20 : RoadCraft (XBX/S)
  • May 21 : Fantasy Life i: The Girl Who Steals Time (XBX/S)
  • May 22 : Blades of Fire (XBX/S)
  • May 23 : Onimusha 2: Samurai's Destiny Remastered (XBO)
  • May 28 : Pipistrello and the Cursed Yoyo (XBX/S, XBO)
  • May 28 : to a T (XBX/S)
  • May 29 : Fuga: Melodies of Steel 3 (XBX/S, XBO)
  • May 29 : Steam-Heart's & Advanced Variable Geo Saturn Tribute (XBO)
  • May 30 : Elden Ring Nightreign (XBX/S, XBO)

Major 2025 Xbox Games With Post-May Dates Or No Release Dates

Marvel, GTA, & More

2025 is coming along nicely. While only a percentage of the year's calendar has been announced, quite a few publishers and developers have confirmed that they have projects that could come out during 2025. Rockstar's Grand Theft Auto 6 will almost certainly be the biggest debut of any year, and its launch does not seem that far off. FBC: Firebreak , Little Nightmares 3 , Marvel 1943 , Dinos Reborn , and Mafia: The Old Country could define 2025, assuming they are not delayed.

The summer season's upcoming Xbox games are starting to be announced, including a couple of major names. Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater , Hell is Us , Tales of the Shire: A Lord of The Rings Game , Borderlands 4 , and Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 are all pretty big deals.

​​​​​​

Major Upcoming Xbox Games With No Release Year

Kingdom Come, Elder Scrolls, & More

"Coming soon" can mean anything from a few months to a couple of years. Beyond Good and Evil 2 and Control 2 are just two games in development, but players will have to wait patiently to learn when these sequels will be made available to play.

There are so many exciting announced projects that will eventually come to the Xbox Series X/S, some of which have revealed very little information about themselves. The Elder Scrolls 6 , Kingdom Hearts 4 , and Ark 2 are all highly-anticipated titles that could still be a long way off from becoming a reality, and these projects are just the tip of the iceberg.

item.title: CoD Warzone: Best Quickscoping Loadout
item.description:
Whether players drop into Resurgence or Battle Royale — where most engagements occur at long distances — many still rely on a solid quickscoping loadout to take down enemies efficiently in Call of Duty: Warzone . Quickscoping has become a staple of CoD , and while the franchise’s battle royale mode isn’t as fast-paced as Multiplayer, many players continue to take advantage of its speed and precision.

While some players prefer a heavy Sniper Rifle, others seek a lighter option that offers greater mobility and excels at quickscoping for fast enemy elimination. With frequent weapon balance changes, finding the ideal Sniper Rifle for this playstyle can be challenging. To help, here’s the best quickscoping loadouts for CoD Warzone , covering the top weapons, attachments, perks, and equipment.

Best Rifles For Quickscoping In Warzone

With Warzone featuring a diverse selection of Rifles from Black Ops 6 , Modern Warfare 3 , and Modern Warfare 2 , players have several top-tier options to choose from. Some standout choices include the LW3A1 Frostline (Black Ops 6), MORS (MW3), and the Kar98k (MW3).

This guide highlights a Sniper from both BO6 and MW3 , along with the Kar98k, a fan-favorite alternative that remains one of the most popular weapons in the battle royale, despite not being classified as a Sniper Rifle. Although Sniper Rifles are often the preferred choice for many Warzone players due to their high damage output and fast bullet velocity, the Kar98k remains a fan favorite. Its competitive damage, solid bullet velocity, and quick, responsive handling make it a top pick, especially for those who value mobility.

Best LW3A1 Frostline Loadout For Quickscoping In Warzone

  • Muzzle: Suppressor
  • Barrel: Long Barrel
  • Stock Pad: Lightweight Pad
  • Comb: Quickdraw Riser
  • Fire Mods: 7.62 NATO Overpressured

Damage (Head/Torso/Legs)

Bullet Velocity

Fire Rate

Mag Size

Reload Time

Sprint to Fire

ADS Speed

300 / 165 / 150

1012 ms

45 RPM

5 Rounds

3.3 seconds

290 ms

475 ms

The LW3A1 Frostline is one of the most well-rounded Warzone Sniper Rifles, offering a top-tier ADS speed for quick and precise quickscoping , along with high bullet velocity for long-range engagements. This loadout enables one-shot headshot eliminations from up to 73 meters while maintaining excellent mobility , making it easy to reposition and engage enemies effectively in any situation. Additionally, its well-balanced reload speed and magazine size make it a strong choice for quickscoping in Warzone , minimizing exposure during engagements against enemies using assault rifles or other mid-to-long-range weapons.

Best MORS Loadout For Quickscoping In Warzone

  • Barrel: Tonne Heavy Barrel
  • Stock: Icarus Light Stock
  • Laser: Corio LAZ-44 V3
  • Ammunition: HVP Anti-Materiel Slug
  • Bolt: Quick Bolt

Damage (Head/Torso/Legs)

Bullet Velocity

Fire Rate

Mag Size

Reload Time

Sprint to Fire

ADS Speed

369 / 218 / 159

792 ms

200 RPM

1 Round

1.4 seconds

256 ms

541 ms

The MORS made its return during MW3 and quickly became a fan-favorite Sniper Rifle in Warzone , thanks to its versatility and the ability to equip the Quick Bolt attachment . This enhancement enables faster reloading and quicker follow-up shots , making it an excellent choice for agile quickscoping . With its high fire rate and competitive bullet velocity, the MORS can eliminate enemies with a single shot to the head from up to 70 meters , making it a deadly option for aggressive Snipers. This optimized loadout focuses on reducing reload speed and improving accuracy, while also enhancing damage range and bullet velocity for effortless enemy takedowns.

Best Kar98k Loadout For Quickscoping In Warzone

  • Optic: Range Caller V3.4 Optic
  • Muzzle: Sonic Suppressor L
  • Barrel: Präzisionsgewehr 762 Long Barrel
  • Sling: Recon Sling
  • Ammunition: 7.92 High Grain Rounds

Damage (Head/Torso/Legs)

Bullet Velocity

Fire Rate

Mag Size

Reload Time

Sprint to Fire

ADS Speed

300 / 142 / 142

904 ms

55 RPM

5 Rounds

5.6 seconds

287 ms

429 ms

Warzone 's Kar98k is a fan-favorite rifle known for its smooth and precise quickscoping experience. Since the game’s earliest iteration, it has remained one of the most popular choices, offering exceptional mobility and accuracy as a Marksman Rifle , which makes it lighter than traditional Sniper Rifles and easier to handle while firing on the move.

With a fast ADS speed , it allows players to chain shots effectively, though it features a slightly slower reload system, holding five rounds per magazine — similar to the MORS but with a larger clip size. While its one-shot headshot range is limited to 57 meters , it remains a top-tier option for quickscoping, where engagements typically happen at closer distances. Additionally, its competitive bullet velocity ensures reliable eliminations with minimal lead time.

Best Perks For Quickscoping In Warzone

The best Warzone Perks for quickscoping are those that provide crucial awareness , helping you avoid unexpected eliminations while engaging enemies at various distances. To stay ahead, equipping Tracker and Alertness is essential. These perks offer valuable in-game notifications , such as visible enemy footprints on the ground and a colored halo around your POV when targeted , ensuring you’re always aware of potential threats.

Since quickscoping demands full concentration and rapid reflexes, managing ammunition is just as important. Scavenger becomes a key perk, automatically replenishing ammo and armor plates from defeated enemies . This not only prevents you from running dry during engagements but also ensures you start with maximum ammo reserves, keeping you prepared for any fight — including against other Snipers and Marksman Rifle users.

Best Quickscoper Loadout In Warzone

Type

Item

Description

Why You Should Use It

Marksman Rifle

Kar98k

A modernized version of a WWII bolt-action rifle is powerful and accurate. High damage output with a slow rate of fire.

Fast ADS, great mobility, and strong damage output.

SMG

C9

Full-auto submachine gun. Well rounded with average rate of fire, damage, and handling.

A reliable backup weapon for close-range engagements in challenging situations, offering well-balanced stats, including high damage, a fast rate of fire, and exceptional mobility.

Tactical

Stim Shot

Combat stim that heals wounds and refreshes Tactical Sprint. Recharges on a cooldown.

Grants a mobility boost and triggers health regeneration.

Lethal

Throwing Knife

Retraitable knife that is lethal on impact to unarmored targets or the head.

A great choice to finish off enemies and allows quickscoping without any additional threats.

Perk 1

Scavanger

Start equipped with maximum reserve ammo for your primary weapon. Resupply ammo, equipment, and plates from dead enemies. Maximum primary ammunition from Loadout acquisition only.

Provides constant ammunition to avoid running out of bullets during confrontations and to have maximum ammunition in the weapons reserve.

Perk 2

Tracker

See enemy footsteps. Bullets you fire briefly mark an enemy for you and your squad. Enemies that down you are automatically pinged. Hitting enemies from farther away increases the time they are outlined.

Stay alert to enemy movements by tracking their footsteps on the ground and gaining insight into the location of the opponent who took you down.

Perk 3

Alertness

Sense when enemies are nearby. Tell when you are being aimed at by an enemy.

Take cover from enemies outside your line of sight, reassess your strategy, and improve the accuracy of your quickscopes for a more precise attack.

Wildcard

Overkill

Equip two primary or secondary weapons.

Since the first will be a Sniper Rifle, carrying a close-range weapon like an SMG can be essential for close-quarters defense in challenging situations.
